com.venomvendor.gson

Class NullDefenseTypeAdapterFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.venomvendor.gson.NullDefenseTypeAdapterFactory

  • public final class NullDefenseTypeAdapterFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Adapter for removing null objects & empty Collections, once object is created.

    Incase of Collection, empty collection is invalid unless retainEmptyCollection() is called explicitly to retain empty collection. This can be useful incase of search results.

    This also processes all collection & finally removes null from Collection, further processes collection to remove all null from results.

       public class Parent {
        @Mandatory
        @SerializedName("name")
        private String name;

        @Mandatory
        @SerializedName("children")
        private CustomList children;

        @SerializedName("id")
        private Integer id

        ...
        setters/getters
        ...
   }
    When registered, Gson will remove the Whole object if any of the field marked as Mandatory is null, however the same is not applicable for Primitive types. Refer: com.google.gson.internal.Primitives#isPrimitive(Type) 

    TypeAdapterFactory typeAdapter = new NullDefenseTypeAdapterFactory(Mandatory.class)
         // To retain empty collection
         .retainEmptyCollection()
         // To remove empty collection, this is default
         .removeEmptyCollection();

     Gson gson = new GsonBuilder()
         .registerTypeAdapterFactory(typeAdapter)
         .enableComplexMapKeySerialization()
         .setPrettyPrinting()
         .setLenient()
         .serializeNulls()
         .create();

      NullDefenseTypeAdapterFactory removeEmptyCollection()
      This will remove empty Collection.
      NullDefenseTypeAdapterFactory retainEmptyCollection()
      This will RETAIN empty Collection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NullDefenseTypeAdapterFactory

        public NullDefenseTypeAdapterFactory(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> annotatedType)
        Requires annotated class for checking fields with annotation.

        Example

         @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
 @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
 public @interface Mandatory { }
        Parameters:
        annotatedType - Class used for marking fields as mandatory, this has to be of retention type RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if annotated class is null

    • Method Detail

      • removeEmptyCollection

        public NullDefenseTypeAdapterFactory removeEmptyCollection()
        This will remove empty Collection. i.e collection.isEmpty(). By default null is removed irrespective of any Type.
        Returns:
        A copy of current instance

      • retainEmptyCollection

        public NullDefenseTypeAdapterFactory retainEmptyCollection()
        This will RETAIN empty Collection. i.e collection.isEmpty()
        Returns:
        A copy of current instance

      • create

        public <T> <any> create(Gson gson,
                        <any> type)
